item.title: Games With The Best Base Building Mechanics, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Base-building games vary in focus and style, with only a few games exemplifying the true essence of the genre.
  • Games like Fallout 4 and 7 Days to Die offer unique base-building mechanics with survival elements.
  • From surviving zombie attacks to managing a cult settlement, base-building games offer diverse experiences for players.

There are a lot of games out there that give players the creative tools to create what they want in order to move forward in a game. This is one of the biggest elements of the best base-building games , a genre that has a collection of games that have their main focus revolve around creating an effective home. The base-building genre can be a bit loose by definition, so there are plenty of games out there that can claim to be perfectly fit underneath the label.

However, it's important for people who want to experiment with this mechanic to check out the best base-building games around so that they can see the true draw of this mechanic. Players will lose hours upon hours in these video games as they strive to create the best base possible after gathering a ton of materials. It can take a while, but players who put in the effort will see their bases flourish to become something special.

Updated on March 20, 2025, by Usama Ali : Base-building games take players to a place where they can become master architects and build their own civilizations. From the first humble shelter to a thriving city, players can meticulously plan every detail of their expanding settlements. Of course, they’ll run into different challenges, like resource scarcity, environmental hazards, population management, and other unexpected events. Even with these obstacles, these games are a haven for those who relish the challenges of problem-solving, the intricacies of resource management, and the sheer joy of constructing personalized, evolving worlds. We’ve updated this list with more base-building games that push the boundaries of the genre, introducing innovative mechanics that redefine what it means to build.

37 Fallout 76

Players Can Build Portable C.A.M.P.s

Fallout 76 had a bad rap back when it launched, but a slew of updates and expansions have done a great job of making the game palatable in the eyes of many once again. Given how big the Fallout TV adaptation has become, most people would love to check out a multiplayer-focused game in this post-apocalyptic series.

The settlement-building mechanics from Fallout 4 are present in this title, albeit in a unique manner. The C.A.M.P.s in this game are portable and can be decked out with the right materials. Bringing out a cozy crash pad in the middle of the wasteland is a unique way to let players interact with one of the best base-building games that's a ton of fun to interact with.

36 Dragon Quest Builders 2

Base-Building Mechanics That Elicit Minecraft's Vibe

The Dragon Quest series has slowly gained more traction in the West, with games like Dragon Quest 11 doing a great job of modernizing the series with some much-needed gameplay improvements and quality-of-life changes. Another great way that Square Enix has tried to broaden the appeal of this series is with a spin-off that adds a unique gameplay element to the series.

Dragon Quest Builders and its sequel are two of the best base-building games JRPG fans can check out. The traditional turn-based combat of the series may be replaced with a real-time action variant, but that shouldn't take anything away from the allure of this brilliant game. Players will love gathering materials and turning their unimpressive base into something special as they slowly but surely make progress in this well-paced game.

35 Fallout 4

Base-Building Is A Fun Distraction, Even If It Lacks Some Depth

Fallout 4 is a video game that players have slowly come to appreciate, especially after Starfield highlighted how important it was for Bethesda's core gameplay loop to require handcrafted open worlds with many unique visuals, landmarks, and one-of-a-kind secrets to uncover. Fallout 4 was a huge phenomenon when it launched, with many people loving the settlement-building mechanics this game brought to the table.

Sure, building a base came with a set of restrictions and wasn't as in-depth as most people would've liked, but it was still a great side activity worth checking out for players who wanted to populate their settlements and protect them against any attacks. If players found this mechanic lacking, then mods could always swoop in to save the day.

34 Project Zomboid

Create A Base To Protect Yourself From Zombies

Like most survival games out there, Project Zomboid has intricate base-building mechanics. Project Zomboid is a hardcore, open-world zombie survival game that throws players into a world overrun by the undead. To survive, players need to build a strong base to protect themselves from the hordes of zombies.

When building a base, players should find easily accessible locations to gather resources, like water, food, and building materials, and avoid dangerous areas. Having access to water sources, tough walls, storage space, multiple entry points, and multiple floors are just a few of the things players need to keep in mind. For players looking for a game that pushes their limits and tests their survival and base-building skills, Project Zomboid is the perfect choice.

33 Terraria

Best Alternative for Minecraft Lovers

Terraria is a 2D sandbox adventure game with intricate base-building mechanics. Those who are familiar with Minecraft will enjoy the depth of the crafting system, which rivals or even surpasses Minecraft's in complexity. Nothing is impossible in Terraria, players have complete freedom to design and construct structures of any shape and size, limited only by their imagination.

Interestingly, the biomes of Terraria can influence the look and feel of the bases. Each biome has a unique identity, defined by distinct terrain blocks, collectible treasures, enemies, critters, and other features. Besides this, a fundamental aspect of base building in Terraria is creating suitable houses for NPCs.

Attracting NPCs is important as these helpful characters provide valuable services, such as selling items, healing, and crafting. Additionally, Terraria has many events and enemy invasions. Because of this, many players build very defensive bases. All in all, Terraria is the perfect choice for players looking for a game that pushes their limits and tests their exploration and base-building skills.

32 Medieval Dynasty

Create A Village In Medieval Times

Players who want to check out an engaging survival game set in medieval times that includes base-building elements will love what Medieval Dynasty has to offer. There aren't many historically accurate games that players can sink their teeth in, so it's easy to see why this title will pique the interest of fans who want to check out some of the best base-building games around with a unique setting.

One of the major draws of this game is constructing a village from the ground up, attracting settlers as players create a host of important buildings to help their base grow. This gameplay loop is executed brilliantly and helps Medieval Dynasty stand out as one of the better survival games that will keep players busy for hours on end.

31 No Man’s Sky

Build Your Personal Residence in the Galaxy

Like many open-universe exploration games, No Man's Sky features deeply intricate base-building mechanics. No Man's Sky is a procedurally generated, open-world adventure that throws players into a vast cosmos filled with diverse planets and alien life. Players can establish bases on virtually any planet in the game, opening the doors to exploration and discovery.

When establishing a base in No Man's Sky , players should prioritize locations with readily available resources, such as minerals and gases, and consider the environmental hazards of the planet. Access to power sources, efficient resource extractors, secure storage facilities, and a teleporter for interstellar travel are just a few of the critical aspects players must consider. Another thing to keep in mind is that there are limits to the number of bases and base components that can be created. However, with recent updates, the base-building system has significantly grown and introduced new building components and technologies.

30 7 Days To Die

Form A Base That Can Withstand A Zombie Assault At The End Of Every Week

The key to the best base-building games is to make everything harvestable, giving the player the ability to set up their home wherever they like. This is part of the idea behind 7 Days to Die , a survival horror game that was released in 2013 in early access and still remains so today.

Set in the nuclear apocalypse post-World War III, players must survive while being hunted down by zombies that have come to life due to the effects of the war. Bases are not just a safe haven as they can also be filled with traps that can kill zombies looking to break in.

29 The Wandering Village

Build A Community On Top Of A Moving Giant

City-builders tend to be a very different type of base-building game as they tend to focus more on creating a civilization without a ton of pressure. However, there are a few games that add stakes to this, including the early access title The Wandering Village .

Players work to build a society on the back of a colossal creature that is also attempting to survive on its own. The world has fallen apart thanks to mysterious plants that are poisonous to all, and it is up to the player to build up a community that can protect the people living there as well as the giant the society is built on.

28 Dyson Sphere Program

Set Up A Base In Space

There is something inherently satisfying about exploring space, and setting up a home in space to build a massive factory to complete an important mission is the crux of Dyson Sphere Program . As the leading member of the space alliance COSMO, players are tasked with harnessing the power of Dyson Spheres to fuel humanity's push into the future.

Every new file in Dyson Sphere Program is unique as worlds are procedurally generated, meaning players will discover new planets upon each save. With the engineering skills that are learned, players are able to set up shop on these planets and build massive factories to start building the necessary energy.

27 Palworld

Catch Pals And Build A Base

Palworld is a multi-genre game that combines monster-catching, survival, crafting, and base-building elements. Players can capture a variety of Pokemon-like creatures called Pals, each with unique abilities and personalities.

Even though it sounds a little dark, players can use their captured Pals as labor, or even consume them for food. Players can even customize their base with a variety of decorations, including furniture, plants, and sculptures.

26 Rust

A Multiplayer Base-Building Game Full Of Memorable Organic Moments

Combining the survival genre with base-building is something that has paid off time and time again. What makes Rust so unique is that all of this is augmented by the multiplayer, which can either turn players into the kings of the map or pathetic servants who must acquiesce to the demands of more powerful players to seek shelter in their bases.

It's one of the most unique multiplayer games around and does a great job of letting players immerse themselves in a dog-eat-dog world where death awaits them at every corner. Either building a base or finding one to reside in is important if players want to survive as long as possible, which is important for obvious reasons.

25 Dwarf Fortress

The Ultimate Base-Building Game

A game from 2006, Dwarf Fortress is a game that is presented entirely through text that forms the images of the game. The primary mode is open-ended, so the player can set any kind of goal that they would like. Starting a new game has the world generate various land, oceans, and civilizations.

To survive, players have to decide on where they would like to build a fortress and then create a foundation that will keep those living in the fortress happy while keeping them safe from any dangers.

24 Sons Of The Forest

The Sequel To One Of The Most Critically Acclaimed Base-Building Games Ever Made

Players who are fans of survival games seem to enjoy the stress of needing to build a base to survive the atrocities that they are surrounded by. That is certainly the case of Sons of the Forest , an open-world horror game where players are hunted by cannibals.

A sequel to another successful survival game, Sons of the Forest has a deep building and crafting system that encourages players to interact and use the environment as much as possible. In addition, the game offers co-op for those who don't want to try to survive on their own.

23 Age Of Empires 2

A Classic Base-Building RTS That Needs No Introduction

Speaking of classic games, one game that was all about building civilizations was 1998's Age of Empires 2 . The real-time strategy game has the player focus on building towns and gathering resources, but it also throws in the twist of building armies on top of that to take down enemy civilizations.

If players can conquer a town in Age of Empires 2 , they will have new land that they can play with. Players can take their empire through four different eras that are the equivalent of 1,000 years of time.

22 Timberborn

Control Beavers And Create A Solid Base

The best base-building games tend to be focused on humans trying to protect themselves from the world. But in Timberborn , the humans are the ones who have made the world inhabitable, so it is up to one species to take on the task of surviving and thriving: beavers.

Facing constant drought, players must pick one of two beaver factions and use their skills to build a society that helps produce the resources necessary to survive some major dry spells. The factories are built using the metal left behind by the human world after they perished, which will help the beavers develop useful technology.

21 Once Human

Build A Secure Base That Protects From Enemies And Other Players

Speaking about survival RPGs, Once Human is a free-to-play survival game where base building is a core mechanic. Bases provide a central hub for players to store their loot, craft items, and manage their inventory. Players can build structures like farms and water purifiers to automate resource production.

The best part is, players can share their bases in Once Human with their friends. This makes it easier for all of them to share resources and work together to build a dream base. Players create unique and personalized spaces by adding furniture items, decor, and even lights, both indoors and outdoors, to illuminate the base. They can also add fridges to preserve food and manage their hunger levels.

20 Valheim

A Great Survival Game With Base-Building Elements Set In Norse Mythology

A game that was only released in early access in 2021, Valheim has already left its mark as being one of the more fun survival games out there. Along with the need to collect materials and fight off monsters, there is the base-building element to the game that keeps people coming back.

The great thing about building in Valheim is the different locations one may come across. There are a total of six biomes at the moment, from the peaceful Meadows to the freezing cold conditions of the Mountains. There are also the Swamp, the Black Forest, and the Plains.

19 Subnautica

Making An Underwater Base Is A Blast

Exploring the ocean can be scary, and players can experience the unknown firsthand with Subnautica . The survival action-adventure games put players in scuba gear as they swim into the deepest depths of the ocean, discovering various lifeforms on a planet known as "4546B."

Players must survive potential attacks in the ocean while also managing their health, hunger, and more. A big part of Subnautica is building bases that can serve as a home to rest up as well as building new submersibles that can help in the exploration element of the game.

18 Grounded

Making A Base After Being Shrunk Down Is A Novel Concept

Grounded is what would happen if the films A Bug's Life and Honey, I Shrunk The Kids had a video game child. A project that just left early access, the survival game by Obsidian Entertainment has players shrunken down to the size of an ant.

The goal of Grounded is to survive in the backyard that has plenty of hostile insects living in the area. Grounded focuses on building a nice base that is enough of a shelter that lets the player survive the day-night cycle.

item.title: Monster Hunter Wilds Fan Recreates Original Box Art in Photo Mode
item.description:
Summary

  • A Monster Hunter Wilds fan recreated the original game's box art using photo mode while fighting Rathalos.
  • The original Monster Hunter was released in March 2004 for the PlayStation 2.
  • Fans were impressed by the recreation of the box art, as it helped showcase the franchise's evolution.

One Monster Hunter Wilds fan recreated the box art of the first game in the series by using photo mode while fighting a Rathalos. Monster Hunter Wilds has proven to be a big hit with gamers, as it quickly became Capcom's fastest-selling title in the history of the company and has been received well by critics.

The original Monster Hunter was first released in Japan in March 2004 for the PlayStation 2. While the title did offer gamers the ability to play offline by themselves, people received more rewards and encountered exclusive monsters while playing online with others. While the franchise originally filled somewhat of a niche role within the gaming space, each mainline entry has continued to grow in popularity.

In a recent post on Reddit, noiwontcalmdown shared an image of their hunter wielding the Jawblade greatsword against the flagship monster of the first game, Rathalos. The picture does an incredible job of recreating the box art that accompanied the original Monster Hunter on the PlayStation 2. Some fans were quick to point out that it would have been even better if Capcom had made the Origin Armor available, but most were struck by how well the player had reimagined the artwork. While it isn't the flagship monster any longer, Rathalos is still deadly in Monster Hunter Wilds , which means getting the perfect shot likely took quite an effort.

Monster Hunter Wilds Player Recreates the Original Game’s Box Art

Noiwontcalmdown explained that, after they manually paused the game in offline mode, they could go into Monster Hunter Wilds ' photo mode to make a few adjustments. Unfortunately, because the title was paused, they didn't have the ability to swivel the camera or tweak its angle. They could, however, manipulate the field of view and distance of the camera. It seems as if capturing the perfect shot was a process of trial and error that likely took some time, but many fans were ecstatic to see the franchise's original box art come to life in a whole new way.

Another gamer who was recently experimenting with Monster Hunter Wilds ' photo mode noticed that Alma will actually react to the player taking pictures. She'll sometimes wave at the camera or even pull out one of her archeological artifacts to show off. One person even said that entering photo mode caused her to run into the shot in order to pose with the hunter. With so many details to discover and secrets to unravel, many fans seem to be enjoying their time with Monster Hunter Wilds .

item.title: InZOI: How To Get A Creative Studio Key
item.description:
Simulation lovers who cannot wait for InZOI's Early Access release on March 28th will be glad to know that they can get an early demo for the game's Creative Studio for free. To do so, players will need to watch a supported stream for a short amount of time to earn a Steam key. Inzoi's Creative Studio demo is split into two parts, the first of which is the Character Studio , which allows players to create their own Zois. This involves customizing every aspect of their appearance as well as their outfits .

The second mode is the Build Studio , where players can realize their architectural and interior design dreams . This even includes the 3D printer, which enables images to be turned into custom 3D objects to be placed in the world. Both of these creative outlets allow players to get a head start on learning how everything works , and anything they create can be saved for InZOI's Early Access release, which has already received praise from critics.

If players are unable to get an early key in the days following March 20th, the demo will open up for everyone on March 23rd and will be available until InZOI releases.

How To Get A Steam Key For InZOI's Creative Studio

To get started with unlocking a key for InZOI's Creative Studio demo, players can follow this link to the InZOI website. From here, players should carry out the following steps.

  • Wishlist InZOI on Steam. This is the only platform it can be accessed currently.
  • Create a Krafton account if you don't already have one.
  • Link your Krafton account to your Steam account. This is done on the Krafton website and is easier if you're signed into Steam on your device.
  • Link your Krafton account to your Twitch account. This is also done from the Krafton website.

Watch An InZOI Stream On Twitch For 15 Minutes

With everything set up, players can head to Twitch and choose any channel that is currently streaming the InZOI category. Users should see a notification about drops being enabled and, after watching an InZOI stream for 15 minutes , they will unlock their drop. A notification will take them to their Twitch Drops Inventory, and they must click claim . It will not be claimed automatically.

There is no benefit to watching more than one stream, and players do not need to type !drop in the chat, or do anything else.

The Twitch Drops Inventory will also show users their progress if they want to check everything is working during the 15 minutes of view time.

Claim Your Steam Key On InZOI's Drop Event Website

Once players have claimed their drop on Twitch, they simply need to head back to the website for InZOI's drop event. Click the big button that says 'Claim Drop Rewards!' .

This will grant them a Steam Demo Key, the code for which can be copied . There is also a link to Steam where this can be pasted. With that done, players can download and install the InZOI Creative Studio demo .

item.title: Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition - 10 Beginner Tips And Tricks
item.description:
Summary

  • Upgrade Skills constantly for increased damage and effects in Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition.
  • Fighting enemies above the party's level yields more XP, aiding progression in the game.
  • Utilize Data Probes for exploration and Miranium investments for new gear in Xenoblade Chronicles X .

Presented in an enhanced edition with new features, Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition joins the series library on the Nintendo Switch, spotlighting exploration across vast regions. With improved visuals and fresh content, this new version of a JRPG delivers a deeper experience that invites fans to explore a richly designed world.

Although it still preserves certain series traditions, this JRPG by Monolith Soft introduces changes to core gameplay systems that enhance its identity and keep battles exciting. For newcomers venturing into Mira for the first time, beginner tips for Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition are vital to create a satisfying early experience, ensuring fewer setbacks.

10 Do Not Forget To Upgrade Arts Skills

They Are Essential For Characters To Inflict More Damage

The main powers that characters wield in Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition are known as Skill Arts , and they do not progress by earning XP from monster battles. Instead, it is necessary to invest in a resource called Battle Points to upgrade them manually, and one of the best tips for this Sci-Fi JRPG is to do this whenever possible.

That matters because leveling up grants access to stronger equipment, but Skill Arts remain the main source of damage and status effects during fights, making them an invaluable resource in Xenoblade Chronicles X. Hoarding Battle Points for later is not advisable, since immediate upgrades can speed up encounters and improve overall efficiency.

9 Face Enemies Above the Party’s Level

These Fights Are The Best Way To Farm XP In Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition

Even though there are many optional quests, most do not award a robust amount of XP, making combat the best method for leveling in Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition . Taking on enemies at a similar level might seem optimal, but targeting those marked with a yellow name often yields greater rewards, especially when facing them with a solid build and a well-planned strategy.

With solid planning, it is possible to defeat enemies up to ten levels higher and gain hefty XP after each victory . Those seeking a safer approach can aim for weaker foes with a smaller level gap, but focusing on isolated targets is vital, since battling two powerful monsters at once typically ends in defeat.

8 Do Not Neglect Exploration

Learning The Map Is Crucial In Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition

Other entries in the series offer expansive areas, yet none rival the size and freedom found in Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition , especially for those who love open-world design. Some segments of the main quest even demand a certain percentage of map exploration, so relying on fast travel alone is not always practical.

Most regions unlock early after Chapter 3 , but caution is wise since the game uses no level scaling, which can lead to sudden challenges. Certain zones mix low-level enemies with foes above level 60, so staying alert prevents accidental battles against overwhelmingly strong creatures.

7 Try Destroying Certain Enemy Parts During Battle

Essential For Easier Fights And Better Item Drops

Combat is a major mechanic in Xenoblade Chronicles X , encountered during exploration or main story missions, especially in fights with higher-level creatures. To handle tougher foes, focus attacks on specific body parts by pressing R + A or Y, a feature that might seem minor at first but proves key in advanced encounters.

Breaking targeted appendages can block certain enemy skills , a massive advantage in tough confrontations and boss fights, especially when facing advanced creatures. That tactic also boosts item drops at the end of each battle, which helps gather critical resources for future upgrades, making it a core method for steady progression.

6 Use And Customize Soul Voices

New Effects Can Activate In Battle

An important tip in Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition is to watch ally requests during combat, a feature known as Soul Voice. These appear as dialogue boxes, and using the highlighted Art Skill at that moment restores HP for both the player and the requesting character, while also raising their affinity.

Custom settings apply only to the protagonist’s Soul Voices, since story allies lack that option, limiting their impact. Adjusting them to match a preferred battle style yields many benefits, like sharing HP recovery among the entire team or granting valuable buffs that make each fight more manageable.

5 Focus On Affinity Missions Whenever Possible

It Is The Best Way To Unlock New Characters In Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition

Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition features a diverse set of companions, though many remain gated behind Affinity Missions spread across Mira, blocking access to some powerful characters. Some allies join through the main story, but others require completing these special quests, which appear on the map as orange exclamation icons.

So, by completing these missions, players can unlock new party members , providing a serious power boost in combat and bolstering team synergy. Each character also has personal Affinity Quests that grant new Skill Arts, so clearing them can further expand each ally’s abilities and enhance battle potential.

4 Install As Many Data Probes As Possible

They Help With Story Progression

Data Probes anchor exploration in the Open-World of Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition , serving as beacons installed throughout Mira and granting strategic vantage points. Once activated, they reveal details about nearby monsters and resources, while also functioning as fast travel points to shorten long treks between missions.

Later upgrades unlocked through various missions transform these devices into resource collectors that feed valuable materials into party progression, including essential materials. Many items harvested through advanced Data Probes are required for equipment enhancements or story objectives, making consistent deployment of these tools a critical tactic .

3 Invest Miranium In R&D For New Gear

Key To Accessing The Best Items In The Game

As the story advances, new arms manufacturers settle in New Los Angeles, offering valuable gear for surviving Mira’s harsh environments, including advanced Skell parts. Regularly investing Miranium in these facilities through the AM Terminal ensures that inventories stay current, unlocking superior weaponry and armor.

Miranium accumulates passively through Mining Probes placed at FN Sites, though it has a maximum storage cap . Using it on different Arms Manufacturers is always recommended because it leads to better gear choices in Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition , improving offensive and defensive stats.

2 Do Not Overlook The Overdrive Skill

Using These Abilities Is Critical For Many Battles

In Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition , an essential mechanic unlocked late in Chapter 5 is the Overdrive Skill , a key factor in high-level encounters. This special mode activates upon reaching 3,000 TP in battle, granting a temporary combat boost for the entire party’s offense and defense.

Even though 3,000 TP is also the cost of reviving a fallen ally, the Overdrive Skill is still worth using in most scenarios. TP persists between battles, so it helps to accumulate this resource before facing a boss or a tyrant, ensuring a decisive advantage.

1 Equip Allies And The Protagonist With Skills

Best Way To Make Characters Stronger

In Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition , every character can equip Skills, which are passive abilities that boost combat attributes and play vital roles in many builds, from offense to defense. Regularly checking and upgrading these boosts is essential for maximizing power, especially when combining multiple Skills in the same character.

For instance, Steel Flesh is accessible to Lin early on and significantly raises her HP, making battles more manageable, especially during boss encounters. Some classes allow stacking multiple passives on one unit, enabling broad customization and a noticeable lift in damage or survivability.

item.title: WWE 2K25: How To Perform Double Finishers
item.description:
Executing a double finisher in WWE 2K25 is one of the game's most rewarding and cinematic moments. It's a devastating finishing move when your wrestlers are involved in matches such as Triple Threats, Four Way matches, Royal Rumbles, Elimination Chambers, and even classic tag team bouts. WWE fans recreate moments like John Cena's Double Attitude Adjustment on The Big Show and Edge at WrestleMania 25. This incredible feat of strength showcased Cena lifting approximately 650 pounds onto his shoulders before delivering the finisher. This guide will show you how to replicate these moments with the double finisher in WWE 2K25.

How To Perform The Double Finisher In WWE 2K25

The double finisher in WWE 2K25 is the perfect way to end multi-person matches like the Triple Threat and the Fatal Four Way. it's also an excellent way to weaken opponents in Royal Rumble or Battle Royale matches before eliminating them. Use the following steps to use a double in a WWE 2K25 match:

  • Select Play then choose a WWE match with multiple opponents in the ring at the same time.
  • You can adjust your match settings to ensure your chosen WWE Superstar has at least one stored finisher. Or build up to it the normal way after executing a signature move.
  • Grab your first opponent with the Circle/B button , then quickly press the Circle/B+L stick toward the corner to Irish Whip them into the corner.

Don't hold down the Irish Whip button as this will rebound the opponent instead of stacking them.

  • With the first opponent stunned in the corner grab the second opponent and Irish whip them into the same corner so they are both stacked in the corner.
  • Approach both opponents with a stored finisher and press RT/R2 + A/X to perform the Double Finisher from the corner.

How To Assign A WWE Wrestler With A Double Finisher

You can also assign any wrestler with a double finisher in WWE 2K25 using the following steps:

  • Press the RB/R1 button to open the Creations menu and select Move-Set in WWE 2k25 .
  • Then select Moves .
  • Highlight and select Finisher .
  • Scroll down to Other .
  • You can now store a 1 vs 2 Finisher in the stop selection box. You can select, Double Attitude Adjustment, Double Chokeslam, Double Cradle Lift Samoan Drop, or the Double Tornado Slam (The F5).

That's everything required to use and even assign any WWE wrestler with the double finisher in WWE 2K25.
